title: The T Box Is Now Empty
author: frankbmd

posts.post_title: The T Box Is Now Empty
posts.post_content:
Need a Monster in the mail?  Try these on for size.

Cy Seymour, throwing pose, with Polar Bear back in a 2.5 BVG holder.  SOLD

[IMG]http://www.collectorfocus.com/images/show/frankbmd/duplicates/10198/seymour-throwing-pb[/IMG]

James Westlake, a Southern Leaguer, with Piedmont back in an SGC 10 holder.
(He went to get his ears pierced and they missed his whole head.)  SOLD

[IMG]http://www.collectorfocus.com/images/show/frankbmd/duplicates/10327/westlake-sl[/IMG]

Frank La Porte, a Highlander with a Piedmont 350 back in a 2.5 BVG holder.  SOLD

[IMG]http://www.collectorfocus.com/images/show/frankbmd/duplicates/10138/laporte[/IMG]

Ira Thomas, also with a Piedmont 350 back and half a name in a 4MC PSA holder  SOLD

[IMG]http://www.collectorfocus.com/images/show/frankbmd/duplicates/10584/thomas[/IMG]

Prices have been rolled back with every penny trimmed.  You wont find better prices at Walmart.  Check, MO, PP no fee, PP reg (Add $1), or I'll trade for chickens.  SOLD

I'm thinking about grabbing one or two, but you're not on the trusted list. Let me get some referrals and I'll get back to ya...


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

[quote name="VistaViper" post=1230419]What's the trusted list?[/QUOTE]

A list of the most elite of elite "players" here on Net54 :eek::D

There was recently a thread listing some trusted sellers and buyers and I was referring back to that, but I was just messin' with Frank...as he is very well known and very trustworthy.

I give Frank my A+ stamp of approval :cool:
Frank, awesome use of the numbers 2,3,7,9!  Sounds like a good number to play on the lottery tomorrow...

[quote name="Bpm0014" post=1230527]Frank, awesome use of the numbers 2,3,7,9!  Sounds like a good number to play on the lottery tomorrow...[/QUOTE]

If someone made an offer of $97.32, I might take it.;)
but would you take $2.973?...I'd even round up?

[quote name="ullmandds" post=1230601]but would you take $2.973?...I'd even round up?[/QUOTE]

Yes Pete, when you learn to type.  I'm sure you meant $2,973.  For $3,000, I'll even accept regular Paypal and deliver them in person.:D

Footnote:  This thread could end up being the most popular BST thread without an offer to buy or a price cut bump.:rolleyes:

[QUOTE]Footnote: This thread could end up being the most popular BST thread without an offer to buy or a price cut bump.[/QUOTE]

Not popular w/ me! It's too confused to make me wanna' post.:)
